page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content:
There is a wide variety of houses in Souldrop village, from the{half- {timbered buildings}such as Lamb's Cottage and Church Farm through to post-war bungalows and houses.
Although many of the older properties would have been thatched originally, all the houses now have{slate or tile roofs. The smaller farm workers'{cottages still had bare brick walls and a range fitted in the front room for cooking when some of the present occupants moved in and until two years ago they used chemical toilets - a tanker called each week to empty them!
One of the biggest recent developments was the row of eight{council houses built in the late 1950's by the then Bedford Rural District Council.
